description: Describes the specified EC2 Fleet or all of your EC2 Fleets. For more information, see Describe your EC2 Fleet in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

parameters.name: FleetIds
parameters.description: The IDs of the EC2 Fleets. (string) ---

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: The filters. activity-status - The progress of the EC2 Fleet ( error | pending-fulfillment | pending-termination | fulfilled). excess-capacity-termination-policy - Indicates whether to terminate running instances if the target capacity is decreased below the current EC2 Fleet size ( true | false). fleet-state - The state of the EC2 Fleet ( submitted | active | deleted | failed | deleted-running | deleted-terminating | modifying). replace-unhealthy-instances - Indicates whether EC2 Fleet should replace unhealthy instances ( true | false). type - The type of request ( instant | request | maintain). (dict) --- A filter name and value pair that is used to return a more specific list of results from a describe operation. Filters can be used to match a set of resources by specific criteria, such as tags, attributes, or IDs. If you specify multiple filters, the filters are joined with an AND, and the request returns only results that match all of the specified filters. For more information, see List and filter using the CLI and API in the Amazon EC2 User Guide. Name (string) --- The name of the filter. Filter names are case-sensitive. Values (list) --- The filter values. Filter values are case-sensitive. If you specify multiple values for a filter, the values are joined with an OR, and the request returns all results that match any of the specified values. (string) ---

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to include in another request to get the next page of items. This value is null when there are no more items to return.

nested_items.name: Fleets
nested_items.description: Information about the EC2 Fleets.

nested_items.name: ActivityStatus
nested_items.description: The progress of the EC2 Fleet. If there is an error, the status is error. After all requests are placed, the status is pending_fulfillment. If the size of the EC2 Fleet is equal to or greater than its target capacity, the status is fulfilled. If the size of the EC2 Fleet is decreased, the status is pending_termination while instances are terminating.

nested_items.name: CreateTime
nested_items.description: The creation date and time of the EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: FleetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: FleetState
nested_items.description: The state of the EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: ClientToken
nested_items.description: Unique, case-sensitive identifier that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request. For more information, see Ensuring idempotency.

nested_items.name: ExcessCapacityTerminationPolicy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether running instances should be terminated if the target capacity of the EC2 Fleet is decreased below the current size of the EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: FulfilledCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units fulfilled by this request compared to the set target capacity.

nested_items.name: FulfilledOnDemandCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units fulfilled by this request compared to the set target On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateConfigs
nested_items.description: The launch template and overrides.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The launch template version number, $Latest, or $Default. You must specify a value, otherwise the request fails.

nested_items.name: Overrides
nested_items.description: Any parameters that you specify override the same parameters in the launch template.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: MaxPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum price per unit hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance. We do not recommend using this parameter because it can lead to increased interruptions. If you do not specify this parameter, you will pay the current Spot price.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: WeightedCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units provided by the specified instance type. These are the same units that you chose to set the target capacity in terms of instances, or a performance characteristic such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority for the launch template override. The highest priority is launched first.

nested_items.name: Placement
nested_items.description: The location where the instance launched, if applicable.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group that the instance is in.

nested_items.name: InstanceRequirements
nested_items.description: The attributes for the instance types. When you specify instance attributes, Amazon EC2 will identify instance types with those attributes.

nested_items.name: VCpuCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of vCPUs.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of vCPUs. If the value is 0, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of vCPUs. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: MemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: CpuManufacturers
nested_items.description: The CPU manufacturers to include.
For instance types with Intel CPUs, specify intel.
For instance types with AMD CPUs, specify amd.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services CPUs, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with Apple CPUs, specify apple.

nested_items.name: MemoryGiBPerVCpu
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: ExcludedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to exclude.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGenerations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether current or previous generation instance types are included. The current generation instance types are recommended for use. Current generation instance types are typically the latest two to three generations in each instance family. For more information, see Instance types in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SpotMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified Spot price. The identified Spot price is the Spot price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified Spot price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose Spot price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: OnDemandMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BareMetal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether bare metal instance types must be included, excluded, or required.
To include bare metal instance types, specify included.
To require only bare metal instance types, specify required.
To exclude bare metal instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: BurstablePerformance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether burstable performance T instance types are included, excluded, or required. For more information, see Burstable performance instances.
To include burstable performance instance types, specify included.
To require only burstable performance instance types, specify required.
To exclude burstable performance instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: RequireHibernateSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must support hibernation for On-Demand Instances.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of network interfaces.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: LocalStorage
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types with instance store volumes are included, excluded, or required. For more information, Amazon EC2 instance store in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
To include instance types with instance store volumes, specify included.
To require only instance types with instance store volumes, specify required.
To exclude instance types with instance store volumes, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: LocalStorageTypes
nested_items.description: The type of local storage that is required.
For instance types with hard disk drive (HDD) storage, specify hdd.
For instance types with solid state drive (SSD) storage, specify ssd.

nested_items.name: TotalLocalStorageGB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total local storage, in GB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: BaselineEbsBandwidthMbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum baseline bandwidth to Amazon EBS, in Mbps. For more information, see Amazon EBS---optimized instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTypes
nested_items.description: The accelerator types that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with FPGA accelerators, specify fpga.
For instance types with GPU accelerators, specify gpu.
For instance types with Inference accelerators, specify inference.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, or Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips) on an instance.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorManufacturers
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must have accelerators by specific manufacturers.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services devices, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with AMD devices, specify amd.
For instance types with Habana devices, specify habana.
For instance types with NVIDIA devices, specify nvidia.
For instance types with Xilinx devices, specify xilinx.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorNames
nested_items.description: The accelerators that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with NVIDIA A10G GPUs, specify a10g.
For instance types with NVIDIA A100 GPUs, specify a100.
For instance types with NVIDIA H100 GPUs, specify h100.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips, specify inferentia.
For instance types with NVIDIA GRID K520 GPUs, specify k520.
For instance types with NVIDIA K80 GPUs, specify k80.
For instance types with NVIDIA M60 GPUs, specify m60.
For instance types with AMD Radeon Pro V520 GPUs, specify radeon-pro-v520.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4 GPUs, specify t4.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4G GPUs, specify t4g.
For instance types with Xilinx VU9P FPGAs, specify vu9p.
For instance types with NVIDIA V100 GPUs, specify v100.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTotalMemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total accelerator memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: NetworkBandwidthGbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of network bandwidth, in gigabits per second (Gbps).

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AllowedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxSpotPriceAsPercentageOfOptimalOnDemandPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage of an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BaselinePerformanceFactors
nested_items.description: The baseline performance to consider, using an instance family as a baseline reference. The instance family establishes the lowest acceptable level of performance. Amazon EC2 uses this baseline to guide instance type selection, but there is no guarantee that the selected instance types will always exceed the baseline for every application. Currently, this parameter only supports CPU performance as a baseline performance factor. For more information, see Performance protection in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: References
nested_items.description: Specify an instance family to use as the baseline reference for CPU performance. All instance types that match your specified attributes will be compared against the CPU performance of the referenced instance family, regardless of CPU manufacturer or architecture differences.

nested_items.name: InstanceFamily
nested_items.description: The instance family to use as a baseline reference.
c1
g3 | g3s.
hpc7g.
m1 | m2
mac1 | mac2 | mac2-m1ultra | mac2-m2 | mac2-m2pro.
p3dn | p4d | p5
t1
u-12tb1 | u-18tb1 | u-24tb1 | u-3tb1 | u-6tb1 | u-9tb1 | u7i-12tb | u7in-16tb | u7in-24tb | u7in-32tb.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI in the format ami-17characters00000.
resolve:ssm:public-parameter.

nested_items.name: BlockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mappings, which define the EBS volumes and instance store volumes to attach to the instance at launch.

nested_items.name: DeviceName
nested_items.description: The device name (for example, /dev/sdh or xvdh).

nested_items.name: VirtualName
nested_items.description: The virtual device name.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume is encrypted.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). For gp3, io1, and io2 volumes, this represents the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For gp2 volumes, this represents the baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for bursting.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: of the customer managed KMS key to use for EBS encryption.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The ID of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: VolumeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the volume, in GiBs.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. For more information, see Amazon EBS volume types in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

nested_items.name: NoDevice
nested_items.description: Suppresses the specified device included in the block device mapping.

nested_items.name: TargetCapacitySpecification
nested_items.description: The number of units to request. You can choose to set the target capacity in terms of instances or a performance characteristic that is important to your application workload, such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O. If the request type is maintain, you can specify a target capacity of 0 and add capacity later.

nested_items.name: TotalTargetCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units to request, filled the default target capacity type.

nested_items.name: OnDemandTargetCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of On-Demand units to request. If you specify a target capacity for Spot units, you cannot specify a target capacity for On-Demand units.

nested_items.name: SpotTargetCapacity
nested_items.description: The maximum number of Spot units to launch. If you specify a target capacity for On-Demand units, you cannot specify a target capacity for Spot units.

nested_items.name: DefaultTargetCapacityType
nested_items.description: The default target capacity type.

nested_items.name: TargetCapacityUnitType
nested_items.description: The unit for the target capacity.

nested_items.name: TerminateInstancesWithExpiration
nested_items.description: Indicates whether running instances should be terminated when the EC2 Fleet expires.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of request. Indicates whether the EC2 Fleet only requests the target capacity, or also attempts to maintain it. If you request a certain target capacity, EC2 Fleet only places the required requests; it does not attempt to replenish instances if capacity is diminished, and it does not submit requests in alternative capacity pools if capacity is unavailable. To maintain a certain target capacity, EC2 Fleet places the required requests to meet this target capacity. It also automatically replenishes any interrupted Spot Instances. Default: maintain.

nested_items.name: ValidFrom
nested_items.description: The start date and time of the request, in UTC format (for example, YYYY-MM-DD*T*HH:MM:*SS*Z). The default is to start fulfilling the request immediately.

nested_items.name: ValidUntil
nested_items.description: The end date and time of the request, in UTC format (for example, YYYY-MM-DD*T*HH:MM:*SS*Z). At this point, no new instance requests are placed or able to fulfill the request. The default end date is 7 days from the current date.

nested_items.name: ReplaceUnhealthyInstances
nested_items.description: Indicates whether EC2 Fleet should replace unhealthy Spot Instances. Supported only for fleets of type maintain. For more information, see EC2 Fleet health checks in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: SpotOptions
nested_items.description: The configuration of Spot Instances in an EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The strategy that determines how to allocate the target Spot Instance capacity across the Spot Instance pools specified by the EC2 Fleet launch configuration. For more information, see Allocation strategies for Spot Instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: MaintenanceStrategies
nested_items.description: The strategies for managing your workloads on your Spot Instances that will be interrupted. Currently only the capacity rebalance strategy is available.

nested_items.name: CapacityRebalance
nested_items.description: The strategy to use when Amazon EC2 emits a signal that your Spot Instance is at an elevated risk of being interrupted.

nested_items.name: ReplacementStrategy
nested_items.description: The replacement strategy to use. Only available for fleets of type maintain.

nested_items.name: TerminationDelay
nested_items.description: The amount of time (in seconds) that Amazon EC2 waits before terminating the old Spot Instance after launching a new replacement Spot Instance.

nested_items.name: InstanceInterruptionBehavior
nested_items.description: The behavior when a Spot Instance is interrupted.

nested_items.name: InstancePoolsToUseCount
nested_items.description: The number of Spot pools across which to allocate your target Spot capacity. Supported only when AllocationStrategy is set to lowest-price. EC2 Fleet selects the cheapest Spot pools and evenly allocates your target Spot capacity across the number of Spot pools that you specify.

nested_items.name: SingleInstanceType
nested_items.description: Indicates that the fleet uses a single instance type to launch all Spot Instances in the fleet.

nested_items.name: SingleAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Indicates that the fleet launches all Spot Instances into a single Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: MinTargetCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum target capacity for Spot Instances in the fleet. If this minimum capacity isn't reached, no instances are launched.

nested_items.name: MaxTotalPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum amount per hour for Spot Instances that you're willing to pay. We do not recommend using this parameter because it can lead to increased interruptions. If you do not specify this parameter, you will pay the current Spot price.

nested_items.name: OnDemandOptions
nested_items.description: The allocation strategy of On-Demand Instances in an EC2 Fleet.

nested_items.name: AllocationStrategy
nested_items.description: The strategy that determines the order of the launch template overrides to use in fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: CapacityReservationOptions
nested_items.description: The strategy for using unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: UsageStrategy
nested_items.description: Indicates whether to use unused Capacity Reservations for fulfilling On-Demand capacity.

nested_items.name: SingleInstanceType
nested_items.description: Indicates that the fleet uses a single instance type to launch all On-Demand Instances in the fleet.

nested_items.name: SingleAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Indicates that the fleet launches all On-Demand Instances into a single Availability Zone.

nested_items.name: MinTargetCapacity
nested_items.description: The minimum target capacity for On-Demand Instances in the fleet. If this minimum capacity isn't reached, no instances are launched.

nested_items.name: MaxTotalPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum amount per hour for On-Demand Instances that you're willing to pay.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: The tags for an EC2 Fleet resource.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The key of the tag.

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: The value of the tag.

nested_items.name: Errors
nested_items.description: Information about the instances that could not be launched by the fleet. Valid only when Type is set to instant.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateAndOverrides
nested_items.description: The launch templates and overrides that were used for launching the instances. The values that you specify in the Overrides replace the values in the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The launch template version number, $Latest, or $Default. You must specify a value, otherwise the request fails.

nested_items.name: Overrides
nested_items.description: Any parameters that you specify override the same parameters in the launch template.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: MaxPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum price per unit hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance. We do not recommend using this parameter because it can lead to increased interruptions. If you do not specify this parameter, you will pay the current Spot price.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: WeightedCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units provided by the specified instance type. These are the same units that you chose to set the target capacity in terms of instances, or a performance characteristic such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority for the launch template override. The highest priority is launched first.

nested_items.name: Placement
nested_items.description: The location where the instance launched, if applicable.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group that the instance is in.

nested_items.name: InstanceRequirements
nested_items.description: The attributes for the instance types. When you specify instance attributes, Amazon EC2 will identify instance types with those attributes.

nested_items.name: VCpuCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of vCPUs.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of vCPUs. If the value is 0, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of vCPUs. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: MemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: CpuManufacturers
nested_items.description: The CPU manufacturers to include.
For instance types with Intel CPUs, specify intel.
For instance types with AMD CPUs, specify amd.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services CPUs, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with Apple CPUs, specify apple.

nested_items.name: MemoryGiBPerVCpu
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: ExcludedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to exclude.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGenerations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether current or previous generation instance types are included. The current generation instance types are recommended for use. Current generation instance types are typically the latest two to three generations in each instance family. For more information, see Instance types in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified Spot price. The identified Spot price is the Spot price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified Spot price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose Spot price exceeds your specified threshold.

The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BareMetal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether bare metal instance types must be included, excluded, or required.
To include bare metal instance types, specify included.
To require only bare metal instance types, specify required.
To exclude bare metal instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: BurstablePerformance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether burstable performance T instance types are included, excluded, or required. For more information, see Burstable performance instances.
To include burstable performance instance types, specify included.
To require only burstable performance instance types, specify required.
To exclude burstable performance instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: RequireHibernateSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must support hibernation for On-Demand Instances.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of network interfaces.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: LocalStorage
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types with instance store volumes are included, excluded, or required. For more information, Amazon EC2 instance store in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
To include instance types with instance store volumes, specify included.
To require only instance types with instance store volumes, specify required.
To exclude instance types with instance store volumes, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: LocalStorageTypes
nested_items.description: The type of local storage that is required.
For instance types with hard disk drive (HDD) storage, specify hdd.
For instance types with solid state drive (SSD) storage, specify ssd.

nested_items.name: TotalLocalStorageGB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total local storage, in GB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: BaselineEbsBandwidthMbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum baseline bandwidth to Amazon EBS, in Mbps. For more information, see Amazon EBS---optimized instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTypes
nested_items.description: The accelerator types that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with FPGA accelerators, specify fpga.
For instance types with GPU accelerators, specify gpu.
For instance types with Inference accelerators, specify inference.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, or Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips) on an instance.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorManufacturers
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must have accelerators by specific manufacturers.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services devices, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with AMD devices, specify amd.
For instance types with Habana devices, specify habana.
For instance types with NVIDIA devices, specify nvidia.
For instance types with Xilinx devices, specify xilinx.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorNames
nested_items.description: The accelerators that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with NVIDIA A10G GPUs, specify a10g.
For instance types with NVIDIA A100 GPUs, specify a100.
For instance types with NVIDIA H100 GPUs, specify h100.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips, specify inferentia.
For instance types with NVIDIA GRID K520 GPUs, specify k520.
For instance types with NVIDIA K80 GPUs, specify k80.
For instance types with NVIDIA M60 GPUs, specify m60.
For instance types with AMD Radeon Pro V520 GPUs, specify radeon-pro-v520.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4 GPUs, specify t4.
For instance types with NVIDIA T4G GPUs, specify t4g.
For instance types with Xilinx VU9P FPGAs, specify vu9p.
For instance types with NVIDIA V100 GPUs, specify v100.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTotalMemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total accelerator memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: NetworkBandwidthGbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of network bandwidth, in gigabits per second (Gbps).

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AllowedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to apply your specified attributes against. All other instance types are ignored, even if they match your specified attributes.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: MaxSpotPriceAsPercentageOfOptimalOnDemandPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage of an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BaselinePerformanceFactors
nested_items.description: The baseline performance to consider, using an instance family as a baseline reference. The instance family establishes the lowest acceptable level of performance. Amazon EC2 uses this baseline to guide instance type selection, but there is no guarantee that the selected instance types will always exceed the baseline for every application. Currently, this parameter only supports CPU performance as a baseline performance factor. For more information, see Performance protection in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: References
nested_items.description: Specify an instance family to use as the baseline reference for CPU performance. All instance types that match your specified attributes will be compared against the CPU performance of the referenced instance family, regardless of CPU manufacturer or architecture differences.

nested_items.name: InstanceFamily
nested_items.description: The instance family to use as a baseline reference.
c1
g3 | g3s.
hpc7g.
m1 | m2
mac1 | mac2 | mac2-m1ultra | mac2-m2 | mac2-m2pro.
p3dn | p4d | p5
t1
u-12tb1 | u-18tb1 | u-24tb1 | u-3tb1 | u-6tb1 | u-9tb1 | u7i-12tb | u7in-16tb | u7in-24tb | u7in-32tb.

nested_items.name: ImageId
nested_items.description: The ID of the AMI in the format ami-17characters00000.
resolve:ssm:public-parameter.

nested_items.name: BlockDeviceMappings
nested_items.description: The block device mappings, which define the EBS volumes and instance store volumes to attach to the instance at launch.

nested_items.name: DeviceName
nested_items.description: The device name (for example, /dev/sdh or xvdh).

nested_items.name: VirtualName
nested_items.description: The virtual device name.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume is encrypted.

nested_items.name: DeleteOnTermination
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the volume is deleted on instance termination.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS). For gp3, io1, and io2 volumes, this represents the number of IOPS that are provisioned for the volume. For gp2 volumes, this represents the baseline performance of the volume and the rate at which the volume accumulates I/O credits for bursting.

nested_items.name: Throughput
nested_items.description: The throughput that the volume supports, in MiB/s.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: of the customer managed KMS key to use for EBS encryption.

nested_items.name: SnapshotId
nested_items.description: The ID of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: VolumeSize
nested_items.description: The size of the volume, in GiBs.

nested_items.name: VolumeType
nested_items.description: The volume type. For more information, see Amazon EBS volume types in the Amazon EBS User Guide.

nested_items.name: NoDevice
nested_items.description: Suppresses the specified device included in the block device mapping.

nested_items.name: Lifecycle
nested_items.description: Indicates if the instance that could not be launched was a Spot Instance or On-Demand Instance.

nested_items.name: ErrorCode
nested_items.description: The error code that indicates why the instance could not be launched. For more information about error codes, see Error codes.

nested_items.name: ErrorMessage
nested_items.description: The error message that describes why the instance could not be launched. For more information about error messages, see Error codes.

nested_items.name: Instances
nested_items.description: Information about the instances that were launched by the fleet. Valid only when Type is set to instant.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateAndOverrides
nested_items.description: The launch templates and overrides that were used for launching the instances. The values that you specify in the Overrides replace the values in the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateSpecification
nested_items.description: The launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateId
nested_items.description: The ID of the launch template.

nested_items.name: LaunchTemplateName
nested_items.description: The name of the launch template.

nested_items.name: Version
nested_items.description: The launch template version number, $Latest, or $Default. You must specify a value, otherwise the request fails.

nested_items.name: Overrides
nested_items.description: Any parameters that you specify override the same parameters in the launch template.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: MaxPrice
nested_items.description: The maximum price per unit hour that you are willing to pay for a Spot Instance. We do not recommend using this parameter because it can lead to increased interruptions. If you do not specify this parameter, you will pay the current Spot price.

nested_items.name: SubnetId
nested_items.description: The ID of the subnet in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: The Availability Zone in which to launch the instances.

nested_items.name: WeightedCapacity
nested_items.description: The number of units provided by the specified instance type. These are the same units that you chose to set the target capacity in terms of instances, or a performance characteristic such as vCPUs, memory, or I/O.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority for the launch template override. The highest priority is launched first.

nested_items.name: Placement
nested_items.description: The location where the instance launched, if applicable.

nested_items.name: GroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the placement group that the instance is in.

nested_items.name: InstanceRequirements
nested_items.description: The attributes for the instance types. When you specify instance attributes, Amazon EC2 will identify instance types with those attributes.

nested_items.name: VCpuCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of vCPUs.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of vCPUs. If the value is 0, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of vCPUs. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: MemoryMiB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: CpuManufacturers
nested_items.description: The CPU manufacturers to include.
For instance types with Intel CPUs, specify intel.
For instance types with AMD CPUs, specify amd.
For instance types with Amazon Web Services CPUs, specify amazon-web-services.
For instance types with Apple CPUs, specify apple.

nested_items.name: MemoryGiBPerVCpu
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of memory per vCPU, in GiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: ExcludedInstanceTypes
nested_items.description: The instance types to exclude.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: InstanceGenerations
nested_items.description: Indicates whether current or previous generation instance types are included. The current generation instance types are recommended for use. Current generation instance types are typically the latest two to three generations in each instance family. For more information, see Instance types in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SpotMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for Spot Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified Spot price. The identified Spot price is the Spot price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. If no current generation C, M, or R instance type matches your attributes, then the identified Spot price is from the lowest priced current generation instance types, and failing that, from the lowest priced previous generation instance types that match your attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose Spot price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: OnDemandMaxPricePercentageOverLowestPrice
nested_items.description: [Price protection] The price protection threshold for On-Demand Instances, as a percentage higher than an identified On-Demand price. The identified On-Demand price is the price of the lowest priced current generation C, M, or R instance type with your specified attributes. When Amazon EC2 selects instance types with your attributes, it will exclude instance types whose price exceeds your specified threshold.

nested_items.name: BareMetal
nested_items.description: Indicates whether bare metal instance types must be included, excluded, or required.
To include bare metal instance types, specify included.
To require only bare metal instance types, specify required.
To exclude bare metal instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: BurstablePerformance
nested_items.description: Indicates whether burstable performance T instance types are included, excluded, or required. For more information, see Burstable performance instances.
To include burstable performance instance types, specify included.
To require only burstable performance instance types, specify required.
To exclude burstable performance instance types, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: RequireHibernateSupport
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types must support hibernation for On-Demand Instances.

nested_items.name: NetworkInterfaceCount
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of network interfaces.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum number of network interfaces. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: LocalStorage
nested_items.description: Indicates whether instance types with instance store volumes are included, excluded, or required. For more information, Amazon EC2 instance store in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.
To include instance types with instance store volumes, specify included.
To require only instance types with instance store volumes, specify required.
To exclude instance types with instance store volumes, specify excluded.

nested_items.name: LocalStorageTypes
nested_items.description: The type of local storage that is required.
For instance types with hard disk drive (HDD) storage, specify hdd.
For instance types with solid state drive (SSD) storage, specify ssd.

nested_items.name: TotalLocalStorageGB
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total local storage, in GB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum amount of total local storage, in GB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: BaselineEbsBandwidthMbps
nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum baseline bandwidth to Amazon EBS, in Mbps. For more information, see Amazon EBS---optimized instances in the Amazon EC2 User Guide.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max
nested_items.description: The maximum baseline bandwidth, in Mbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.name: AcceleratorTypes
nested_items.description: The accelerator types that must be on the instance type.
For instance types with FPGA accelerators, specify fpga.
For instance types with GPU accelerators, specify gpu.
For instance types with Inference accelerators, specify inference.

nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum number of accelerators (GPUs, FPGAs, or Amazon Web Services Inferentia chips) on an instance.

nested_items.description: The maximum number of accelerators. If this parameter is not specified, there is no maximum limit.

nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of total accelerator memory, in MiB.

nested_items.name: Min
nested_items.description: The minimum amount of accelerator memory, in MiB. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: Max

nested_items.description: The minimum and maximum amount of network bandwidth, in gigabits per second (Gbps).

nested_items.description: The minimum amount of network bandwidth, in Gbps. If this parameter is not specified, there is no minimum limit.

nested_items.name: InstanceType
nested_items.description: The instance type.

nested_items.name: Platform
nested_items.description: The value is windows for Windows instances in an EC2 Fleet. Otherwise, the value is blank.

nested_items.name: Context
nested_items.description: Reserved.
